pr_title: Make `HttpObjectDecoder` more RFC7230 compatible and other improvements

timeline.bodyText: IIUC this is just an optimization to avoid attempting to search for CRLF? is this thought to be common?
timeline.author: Scottmitch

replies.bodyText: Can not say it's common, because usually TCP packet includes enough data for the start-line. This is to prevent going inside handlePartialInitialLine when CRLF was not found. Let me move it inside the if statement.
replies.author: idelpivnitskiy

replies.bodyText: Actually, I don't think we need it. Let me kill it :)
replies.author: idelpivnitskiy
